channel.title: CVE Feed for Adobe -- Audition
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Adobe -- Audition

item.title: CVE-2023-47052|2024-09-04T20:46:07.878Z -- adobe -- audition
item.description: Adobe Audition version 24.0 (and earlier) and 23.6.1 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2023-47053|2024-09-04T20:45:00.162Z -- adobe -- audition
item.description: Adobe Audition version 24.0 (and earlier) and 23.6.1 (and earlier) are affected by an Access of Uninitialized Pointer vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2024-30276|2024-06-13T13:25:25.314Z -- adobe -- audition
item.description: Audition versions 24.2, 23.6.4 and earlier Answer: are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2024-30285|2024-06-13T08:24:29.279Z -- adobe -- audition
item.description: Audition versions 24.2, 23.6.4 and earlier are affected by a NULL Pointer Dereference vulnerability that could result in an application denial-of-service condition. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability to crash the application, leading to a denial of service. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.
